edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.router
Class BasicRouter

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.router.AbstractRouter
      edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.router.BasicRouter

public class BasicRouter
extends AbstractRouter

This router is a brute force maze router. It does not have any mechanism to address routing conflicts. It is simply provided as an illustration of how to build a router in RapidSmith and use the given framework. It WILL fail to route some nets on several designs.

Author:
Chris Lavin

Method Detail

setCost

public void setCost(Node node,
                    boolean isRouteThrough)
Cost function, used to set each node's cost to be prioritized by the queue

Parameters:
node - The node to calculate and set its cost based on currSink.

routeConnection

protected void routeConnection(java.util.ArrayList<Node> sources)
Prepares the class variables for the route() method. Sets everything up for each connection to be made. This method is called for each connection in a net by routeNet(). It calls route() once the variables are ready for routing.

Parameters:
sources - The candidate sources to attempt to route from.

route

protected void route()
The heart of the router, it does the actual routing by consuming nodes on the priority queue and determining how to proceed to the sink. It is called by routeConnection().

routeNet

public void routeNet(int i)
This method routes all the connections within a net.

Parameters:
i - The number of the net (in sequence from the beginning)

getSourcesFromPIPs

private void getSourcesFromPIPs(java.util.ArrayList<PIP> pips,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Node> sources)
Creates sources from a list of PIPs

Parameters:
pips - The pips of the net to examine.
sources - An empty list that will be populated by this method.

routeDesign

public Design routeDesign()
This the central method for routing the design in this class. This prepares the nets for routing.

Returns:
The final routed design.
